Events: The War of the Austrian Succession
People: Maria Theresa of the Habsburgs and Charles Albert of Bavaria
Causes: Maria Theresa’s succession to the Austrian throne met with resistance from Charles Albert of Bavaria and Frederick the Great of Prussia
Consequences: Prussia annexes Silesia, Austria grants Prussia free trade in the Italian ports, Prussia secures territory in Poland
Opposing Sides: Maria Theresa and the Austrians against Frederick the Great and the Prussians
Outcomes: The Treaty of Aix-la-Chapelle ultimately ended the conflict, accepting the existing situation with Prussia annexing Silesia
Significance: Prussia’s rise in power and the spread of the War’s conflict to Europe’s colonies
